intro: Metastelma hemipogonoides, commonly known as the white-flowered metastelma, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub characterized by its opposite, elliptic leaves that are usually pubescent on the underside. The plant produces small, white flowers with five petals, which are arranged in cymes and attract various pollinators. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, containing small seeds. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
